titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Edward Claudius Herrick Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Nancy L. Fappiano

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 10:09

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: Correspondence, memoranda, notes, and drawings record Herrick's work in astonomy and entomology, particularly his observations on the Aurora Borealis and the Hessian fly. Prominent scientists among his correspondents include Louis Agassiz, James D. Dana, Thaddeus William Harris, Elias Loomis, Lambert Adolphe Jacques Quetelet, William C. Redfield, Samuel H. Scudder, Benjamin Silliman, Benjamin Silliman Jr., and William Tully. His career as librarian of Yale College (1843-1858) is reflected in catalogues, invoices, and memoranda relating to book purchases for the library. Between 1847 and 1862 he also supervised the publication of the triennial catalogues for Yale College and memoranda concerning these are also in the papers. His financial and legal files contain both personal records and account books (1835-1844) for the booksellers' firm of Herrick and Noyes, of which he was a partner. Also included are papers relating to New Haven including minutes of committee meetings, reports and correspondence on the Bicentennial (1838).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Edward Claudius Herrick Papers (MS 691). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the Beinecke Rare Book Library in 1973.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in five series: I. Correspondence. II. Scientific Files. III. Yale University Files. IV. Financial and Legal Files. V. Miscellaneous Notes and Memorabilia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Edward Claudius Herrick Papers date from 1827 to 1862 and are arranged in five series: I. CORRESPONDENCE, II. SCIENTIFIC FILES, III. YALE UNIVERSITY FILES, IV. FINANCIAL AND LEGAL FILES, and V. MISCELLANEOUS NOTES AND MEMORABILIA.

With few exceptions, CORRESPONDENCE is only incoming letters. Most of the letters deal with scientific subjects; in particular there is a great deal of correspondence about the aurora borealis. Among the important correspondents are Louis Agassiz, James D. Dana, Thaddeus William Harris, Elias Loomis, Lambert-Adolphe Jacques Quetelet, William C. Redfield, Samuel H. Scudder, Benjamin Silliman, Benjamin Silliman, Jr., and William Tully.

SCIENTIFIC FILES is primarily concerned with Herrick's work in astronomy and entomology. His memoranda, notes, and observations of the aurora borealis constitute a major part of the astronomical papers. Herrick's entomological specialty was the Hessian fly, which he spent nine years studying. The papers representing this study include notes, observations, and drawings.

Herrick served as librarian of Yale College from 1843 to 1858. In YALE UNIVERSITY FILES are many records concerning the early years of the Yale College Library. Included are catalogues, invoices, and memoranda regarding books Yale had or wanted to purchase.

After the death of James Kingsley, Herrick assumed responsibility for the Yale College triennial catalogues. His papers include memoranda on the writing and publishing of the catalogue, and information for Yale classes 1847, 1850, 1853, 1856, 1859, and 1862.
FINANCIAL AND LEGAL FILES contains both personal financial records and the business records of Herrick and Noyes, Booksellers.
Of interest in MISCELLANEOUS NOTES AND MEMORANDA are memoranda concerning New Haven, especially the bicentennial celebration and the colonial burial ground.

The papers were transferred from Beinecke Rare Book Library in 1973. Herrick's papers as Yale University treasurer will be found in the Yale archives record group, Finance and Administration, Treasurer's Records (YRG 5-B).

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Edward C. Herrick: Yale University librarian, 1843-1858; treasurer of Yale College, 1852-1862; scientist active in investigating the Hessian fly; also interested in astronomy.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: CORRESPONDENCE is arranged alphabetically by writer. Letters by a particular writer have been arranged chronologically. An asterisk indicates that there are more than ten letters from a particular writer. A complete list of correspondents can be found in the added entries list.
Folders with asterisks (*) contain ten or more items.

did.unittitle: Letters of recommendation written by Edward C. Herrick

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: SCIENTIFIC FILES have been arranged alphabetically and primarily contain material concerning astronomy and entomology.

did.unittitle: Aurora borealis: Register of the Aurora Borealis, New Haven, Connecticut volume 1
Aurora borealis: Register of the Aurora Borealis, New Haven, Connecticut volume 2
Aurora borealis: Register of the Aurora Borealis, New Haven, Connecticut volume 3
Comets: listing of comets seen by scientists
Memoranda on shooting stars and meteors
Notes on the antiquities of shooting stars
Memoranda and notes on the Hessian fly
Notes, especially pertaining to the Hessian fly
Observations on insects which attack wheat and rye
Memoranda and notes on various scientific subjects
Newspaper clippings on astronomy and meteorology
Newspaper clippings on various scientific subjects
Memoranda on shooting stars and meteors

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: YALE UNIVERSITY FILES are arranged alphabetically and primarily contain material on the Yale College Library and the Triennial Catalogue.

did.unittitle: Additions to the Yale College Library
Catalogue and invoice of books imported by Professor Silliman
Catalogue of books bequeathed by Dr. Jacob Porter
Catalogue of books bought by Professor A.D. Stanley
Inventories and listings of books, periodicals journals, and newspapers
Listing of books wanted for the library
Memoranda of books purchased or given
"Obituary Record of Graduates of Yale College deceased during the academical year 1860-1861"
Memoranda concerning the writing and printing of the catalogue
Yale College Catalogue with annotations of the residences for the class of 1805
Summary of the information in the catalogue
Memoranda for the catalogue with memoranda on degrees conferred
Lists about Yale College students and professors

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: FINANCIAL AND LEGAL FILES are arranged alphabetically and contain a large amount of material relating to Herrick & Noyes.

did.unittitle: Account and deeds relating to the estate of Sarah Pierpont
Accounts for the estates of [Ruamah?] and William Canada
Bank account and listing of bills payable
Documents concerned with the application of Hannah Mansfield for a pension
Expenditures and receipts for Hannah Herrick
Letterbook also containing personal notes and memoranda of E.C. Herrick

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: MISCELLANEOUS NOTES AND MEMORABILIA is arranged alphabetically. Most important are the notes and memoranda on New Haven.

did.unittitle: Bells: notes on bells and their tones
Biographical and genealogical notes on individuals and families
Bicentennial: correspondence, minutes from committee meetings and reports
Burial Ground: copies of the epitaphs on gravestones
Memoranda and notes on New Haven and Yale University
Quotations and sayings collected by Herrick
Review of a book by James D. Dana
Photograph of a framed bust of E.C. Herrick
